intro: Plantinia cuspidata, commonly known as the sharp-pointed plantain, is a herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright, ribbed stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers in clusters during the summer months. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their astringent properties. Botanically, it belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its basal rosette growth habit.
